name: Boongarrie Luxury Tent - privacy, luxury, nature
description:
Boongarrie Luxury Tent offers privacy and luxury on a beautiful parcel of land in the Barossa Valley. Wake to views of majestic red gums and in the cooler months enjoy a campfire and savour the Barossa Red left for your enjoyment. Little touches of luxury and generous breakfast supplies make this the perfect place for couples to explore the valley. Why not treat yourself and try something different.

The space
The tent has a luxurious interior with a gorgeous ensuite bathroom.
A large queen size bed, kitchenette, with fridge, microwave, toaster, kettle and plunger coffee facilities, and for your comfort there is a reverse cycle air conditioner, TV and blue tooth speaker.
The bathroom has a rain shower and a claw foot bath, toilet and vanity. Ironing facilities and a hairdryer provided.
Outside there is an outdoor kitchen with a BBQ and a side burner, sink, all utensils and pans cooking facilities and a red gum bar and stools.

Gu
neighborhood_overview: Flaxman Valley is a quiet regional area with some small wineries and farms.
host_about:
My partner Garrry and I have lived in the beautiful Barossa for over 20 years. We enjoy all the fine foods and wines that are at our doorstep and love meeting new people. We enjoy travelling both overseas and in Australia, and love getting away from it all under the stars and living it up in luxury.
We love fishing and retreating when possible, to one of our beach houses on the Yorke Peninsula. 
We understand from our own travelling that guests may want total privacy and independence or wish to have some assistance and interaction.

description:
This lovely 1920's cottage is located in a quiet tree lined street in the heart of Tanunda.
Miriam's is a 5 minute walk to shops and restaurants such as Ferment Asian, 1918, Musque and cafe's. Also walking distance to Langmeil winery, Peter Lehmann, Z Wines etc
Breakfast provisions are there for guests to either have a cooked breakfast of bacon, eggs, tomatoes, mushrooms or continental breakfast, fruit, yogurt, milk, orange juice, tea, coffee
Included is also a cheese plate and bottle of wine.

Bedroom one has Queen bed.

Bedroom two has the choice of two single beds or this can be a King bed. Ideal for couples or singles. Please specify this when booking if needing beds in second bedroom need to be singles.

Guest access

name: Azalea Cedar-Rose Barossa Vineyard Views Villa
description:
Azalea Cedar-Rose has been uniquely refurbished while maintaining its period charm and is perfectly situated to explore Australia's premier wine region, the Barossa Valley.

Boasting 4 spacious and stunning queen size bedrooms, accommodating up to 11.

Two bathrooms, spa bath, bathrobes, comfy couches, a log fire, free Netflix & WiFi

The villa is alluring, beds made, fire set, afternoon tea supplied and beautiful vineyard views

Complimentary port and chocolates.

The space
The moment you step inside you will love the attention to detail and the unique styling with its fine furnishings, Baltic floors, French doors, high ceilings, and lead light windows.
On arrival, help yourself to pod coffee, selection of teas, milk, biscuits which are complimentary. Enjoy chocolate truffles and help yourself to the carafe of local Port wine.
You can purchase the full breakfast package at only $19 pp per night of eggs, smoke
neighborhood_overview:
Easy stroll to bakeries, cafes, restaurants, pubs, super-market, fashion shops, cellar doors and art Galleries.
Hot air-ballooning
Helicopter Scenic flights
Lord Lyndoch Restaurant
Lavender farm
Excellent Tourist office in Tanunda
host_about: Hi, I am happily married to my sweetheart who I met when I was 12. Married at 19, have 4 lovely kids who married 4 lovely partners and we now have 14 adorable grandies!!  We have run a florist shop for 15 years whilst renovating two properties for Bed and Breakfast in the Barossa Valley. Now we have retired from floristry and we are enjoying the beautiful serenity of the Barossa Valley more and more. We love to travel and have been fortunate to visit many countries overseas, which helps when it comes to seeing what our guests in our accommodation need for comfort and an unique experience. Book with us and we will share some fabulous intimate wineries.

name: The Reserve Barossa Valley
description:
The Reserve sits on six acres and accommodates up to 10 people in five bedrooms. It has an open plan fully equipped kitchen for food lovers, three bathrooms, several living and dining areas.
There are magnificent views and a huge outdoor area with a wood fired pizza oven.
The Reserve Barossa Valley is an amazing place to .... escape, relax and indulge all the Barossa has to offer

The space
If you were to pick a dream location in the Barossa The Reserve would be it. Located right smack bang in the middle of all the famous wineries and only minutes along Seppeltsfield Road to some of Australia’s best wineries including; Whistler, Heritage, Two Hands, Torbreck, Tscharke, Barossa Valley Estate, Seppeltsfield, Hentley Farm, Gnadenfrei and Greenock Creek. And just a few more minutes to Penfolds, Jacob’s Creek, Yalumba and Elderton. Appellation (the Barossa’s finest dining) less than a minute away. You can even escape through our back gate, wander through th
neighborhood_overview:
Where are the best Barossa Cellar Doors? Well, many of them can be found along Seppeltsfield Road! These include Hentley Farm, 2015 James Halliday Wine Companion Cellar Door of the Year. Hentley Farm, Greenock Creek Wines,Tscharke’s Place, Izway, Rolf Binder, Heritage, Two Hands and Torbreck are just a few of the wineries along the nine kilometres of Seppeltsfield Road where premium Barossa wines, including many famous Barossa Shiraz wines (the variety the Barossa is most famous for) can be tasted. Whistler Wines is a fabulous spot to combine wine tasting with a platter in the gardens under a gum tree, then visit their rescued pet kangaroos! Many of the wines produced in the Marananga/Seppeltsfield/Greenock sub-region of the Barossa are world class.

We have small, single vineyard producers without cellar doors as well as iconic establishments including the historic Seppeltsfield Estate Winery founded in 1851 and Winner of the 2016 Qantas National Tourism Award for Best Tour
host_about:
There’s something very special about the Barossa. You can feel it in the landscape, in the people, the food and the wine. It’s a beautiful region, with villages, vineyards and farms dotting a patchwork vista. Barossans are famous for their generous hospitality, their love of a shared table and their passion for local food and wine. Festivals, celebrations, markets and music thrive here. Barossa is life’s great pleasures, in one unique place. 

We welcome you to Barossa. The place we love. The place we call home.

name: Pinecone Ridge, Barossa - a rural retreat
description:
Whether you are looking for a base from which to explore the Barossa, or a place in which to bunker down and take a break from a fast-paced life, Pinecone Ridge is for you.

The house is nestled into a ridge top amongst rolling hills and vineyards, and large windows in the open plan living area allow you to enjoy the spectacular views whether you are inside or outside.

The space
The property provides a natural habitat for kangaroos and native birds and early risers can enjoy watching hot air balloons drift across the valley. Fiery summer sunsets & sunrises; autumnal colours; misty winter mornings crisp with frost; and the blossom of spring - the outlook is constantly changing.

The house is self contained with a fully functional kitchen, big comfy couches and a wide selection of games, books, jigsaws & DVDs for your entertainment. Netflix & free WiFi are also available.

Curl up by the wood fire with your favourite port in winter or
neighborhood_overview:
Pinecone Ridge is 2km from the main street of Angaston.

Angaston is arguably the prettiest of the towns in the Barossa. Set amongst rolling hills it offers a well-preserved heritage streetscape lined by large leafy trees. It also sits on the border of the Barossa & Eden Valleys making a perfect base from which to explore both wine regions. It is home to the Barossa Cheese Company, Yalumba, Vitners restaurant, and the not-to-be-missed Barossa Farmers Market amongst many other attractions.
host_about:
Hi! 

Pinecone Ridge is really a family project - we are all involved: Anne, Josh, Jeb, April & Isla.

We purchased the property in Nov 2017 as a family escape & renovation project. The property had previously been owned by a 92 year old gentleman with poor eyesight & needed lots of attention but we could see the potential & loved the views & location.

Running Pinecone Ridge is a family affair. April creates the welcome signs. Isla collects the pinecones. Jeb is Josh’s right hand man when it comes to maintenance. I get the privilege of escaping to the Barossa every week to clean & prep & often Josh is able to join me. In school holidays the kids help too. And we have all contributed to the eclectic styling of the home!

We have created Pinecone Ridge to be our family getaway - cosy, comfortable, fun, creative, peaceful, surrounded by nature - a place in which to clear the head & relax into a slower pace of life, yet also close to the action & deliciousness of the Barossa. We love sharing it with you and reading your reviews together. May you have a wonderful stay!

Anne

name: Pembury Cottage ~ Angaston,  Great location in the Barossa  Valley
description:
PEMBURY SELF CONTAINED ACCOMMODATION CENTRALLY LOCATED IN THE HEART OF ANGASTON

Pembury is a charming, stylish, fully renovated three-bedroom house centrally located for you to explore the Barossa wine region.

Situated at the quiet end of the main street of Angaston, this classic late 1800s cottage features modern and comfortable décor as well as a fully fenced, level backyard.

The space
Pembury is a luxury self-contained property, beautifully renovated, classic late 1800s cottage, with a modern and comfortable décor and secure backyard . Located in historic Angaston Pembury Cottage comfortably accommodates up to 6 guests with 3 king sized bedrooms and a shower room and 2 toilets.
Provisions are supplied for a continental breakfast, on the first morning of your stay.
Settle into the comfortable lounge with a wood burning combustion stove, or head out to the large covered pergola, complete with gas BBQ, or relax in the covered eat
neighborhood_overview:
Angaston known as the Jewel of the Barossa offers a great diversity of restaurants, cafe's, a cooking school and Taste Eden Valley, a tasting room featuring wines exclusively from Eden Valley.

Easy access to the other towns of the Barossa is within a 8 minute drive which opens up this great wine and food region.
Don't forget the Farmers Market every Saturday, do some shopping, have some breakfast and cook up a great dinner in the modern kitchen, Or, let us get the chef to do that for you!
host_about:
Hi
We have lived in the Barossa for 25 years.
Jonathan runs a tour business Barossa taste sensations and Kate is a Physiotherapist.
we enjoy introducing our guests to the area and have a wealth of knowledge at our finger tips to help you have a fantastic stay

description:
Experience the rhythms of farm life in the Hutton Vale Farm Hutch Hilton! Ideal for up to 4 couples or families looking for an authentic Australian experience within the rolling hills of the Barossa.

The space
Think a camping holiday without having to take anything! A good make over of our staff quarters provides 4 seperate bedrooms each with a small ensuite, electric blanket, air conditioning and heating.
An outdoor kitchen with adjoining (semi enclosed) lounge area, open fire, books to read and games to play. Perfect for friends and couples bonding weekends. Fly in by private/charter aircraft landing on the farm's grass airstrip.

Guest access
Enhance your stay by cooking yourself a paddock to plate meal. We produce a range of seasonally available produce including: our premium wine, ethically grown lamb and chutneys/preserves. Pre order is essential (7 days before check in)
Also a great experience is to visit the Barossa Farmer

The wider Barossa has more than 150 winery/cellar doors, 7 award winning restaurants, cafes, bakeries, art galleries, heritage sites, scenic bike track, parks and 2 golf courses.

description:
Luxury Executive accommodation nestled in the heart of the Barossa Valley. These ultra modern three bedroom villas have all the comforts of home plus more. Ideal for couples or families sleeping up to 6 guests.

The space
There are very few wine lovers who have not sampled a drop from the Barossa Valley. Australia's best-known wine region and South Australia's most visited tourist destination is also the home of Discovery Parks - Barossa Valley. Our caravan park is just a few minutes from the centre of Tanunda, a great place to begin your tour.

Explore the vine-covered plains and hills that surround charming townships and Lutheran churches, with their distinctive square spires dotting the rural landscape. Or, enjoy our new splashtacular waterpark! 3 slides, gigantic tipping bucket and more splash zones than we can count = fun for the whole family. With so many wineries, historic buildings, museums, scenic tours, bush walks, art galleries, amazing dining

A 1921 Australian bungalow the house features timber floors, three double bedrooms, two bathrooms, lounge, fully appointed kitchen, separate dining room and is yours exclusively during your stay.

Enjoy short stays away with friends or family to experience all the Barossa Valley has to offer.

name: Old Barossa Valley Inn & Bakery House..Get it all!
description:
Located in the historic section of Lyndoch township, the gateway to the Barossa Valley (1 hour drive from Adelaide CBD). Great place to base yourself for a relaxing food, wine, romantic or family getaway. Extremely comfortable accommodation with an entire end of this unique 1850’s colonial building constructed as the Barossa Inn & licensed until 1912. Price is for 1 guest. Additional guests are $20/person/night. Experience all the Barossa has to offer with Tanunda, Nuriootpa & Angaston nearby.

The space
5 minute walk to town centre with shops, restaurants, hotel, supermarket etc. The B&B is an entire 2 bedroom house (including free wifi), with lounge, kitchen, dining, laundry, bathroom and private rear patio/pergola/garden. There is a sofa-bed in the lounge room which can possibly be used by negotiation.

We provide free wifi as well as Netflix, Stan and Prime. There is also a good collection of DVDs for guests to enjoy.

If you have a big gr
neighborhood_overview: Lyndoch is the ‘Gateway’ to the Barossa Valley. The residence gives you local ambience and history, whilst providing you the opportunity to explore this vibrant tourist wine & food region. Tanunda, Nuriootpa, Angaston and other Barossa Valley towns are all an easy drive way. Wineries and boutique shopping abounds in the area around the B&B.
host_about:
Local Barossa family. Heather & husband Gordon together, offer you this accommodation in one of the historic buildings from the 1850s, in Lyndoch. Lovingly preserved and decorated, we hope our guests will relax and enjoy their stay. We’d be pleased to show you the original bakers oven which served the town for around 60 years. We live nearby and can respond to any requests, or can leave you to enjoy the serenity and luxury of our little piece of paradise!
We enjoy travel ourselves and experiencing AirBnB’s all over the world. Our guests come from all states of Australia, but also from nearly every continent, so it is a great pleasure to host  our guests from all walks of life. 
Enjoy all the Barossa Valley has to offer by basing yourself in Lyndoch with us. We particularly welcome our fellow South Australian residents, to enjoy some local tastes and experiences which are easily accessible, thoroughly delectable and exciting or relaxing - the choice is yours!

name: Martinsell Manor  Barossa Valley South Australia
description:
Private accommodation, self-contained in the downstairs section of this grand Manor.
Book the Gold or Regency room.The main entrance provides access leading into your spacious lounge and dining area. Martinsell Manor, a historical, stately, stone building is set on 77 acres in beautiful surroundings .The impressive guest suites have recently been renovated and include high ceilings, quality Georgian and Chippendale furniture, and Persian carpets on polished floorboards.

The space
A magnificent piece of South Australian history, this turn of the century home has played host to some prominent Australian and international aristocrats, politicians and business people. The grand rooms (Gold or Regency room) and opulent architecture give glimpses of a bygone era. Adelaide's Ashburton Design has seamlessly blended the old world charm with his colours and furnishings, to make a beautiful and elegant environment. The private accommodation is rented as a whole area.
neighborhood_overview: The Manor is 20 minutes from Tanunda
host_about: We are a  retired couple who really enjoy living in the countryside, renovating historical buildings, gardening and hobby farming. Having hosted bed and breakfasts for many years, we enjoy meeting guests from all over the world and providing information on the Barossa area and beyond.

name: Linfield Cottage
description:
Linfield Cottage is a beautifully restored 1900 Federation Home on the edge of the Barossa and the Adelaide Hills. Fully equipped and situated on our stunning 19 hectares of vineyard from which we produce our own wines, it's the perfect base to explore the hundreds of wineries within both regions, or the plethora of scenic walking tracks. When you've finished sightseeing, relax on the property and enjoy the stunning views, soak in the spa and sip on our hand-crafted, single vineyard wines.

Guest access
You'll have access to the entire cottage, terrace, and the garden parking area. Guests are more than welcome to visit our Cellar Door, located next door.

Other things to note
The cottage is situated next to our Cellar Door, which is open Thursday - Sunday. With a separate entrance and plenty of seclusion, you are sure to have a private getaway.
The property is a working vineyard, not fenced and with several dams and waterways.

We live and work on our beautiful vineyard property. We love cooking and enjoying a bottle of our wine overlooking the property. 
Travelling is always on the list of things to do when we have downtime. 
Reading is a great passion in our family and our choices wide and varied.

name: WHISTLER VINEYARD RETREAT
description:
Set on 80acres in the heart of the Barossa Valley this private, self-contained guest wing is surrounded by vineyard and gardens. Our retreat gets you back to nature... with vineyard and scrub walks, (accompanied by at least one of our Border Collies), friendly geese, an inquisitive free-roaming peacock, hens, rescued & wild kangaroos, the occasional Koala and a myriad of birdlife. Take in the views from the verandas, sit by the campfire (during the cooler months) or relax in the hammock.

The space
Our home was designed by us and built in 2002 on a hill overlooking our vineyards. A purpose-built, private two bedroom guest wing with separate entrance, offers fully self-contained accommodation for up to 4 guests. The second bedroom can be configured as a king bed or two singles. Features include a full kitchen with bar fridge and a large open space living area with floor to ceiling windows to capture the views. The living area and both bedrooms have large windows an
neighborhood_overview: Our Retreat is on the most scenic road in the Barossa with 15 wineries to discover, including the historic Seppeltsfield Winery. An exciting new addition, within walking distance, is the new Seppeltsfield Road Distillers where you can enjoy handcrafted gin on their stunning deck. We have world-class restaurants within a 5 minute drive - Appellation, Fino and Hentley Farm. Our neighbours are the famous Maggie Beer Farmshop and Eatery. The work of top SA artists can be seen at the JamFactory gallery and artisan workshops. Other coffee shops, galleries and excellent shopping can be found at the 3 main towns, all within 5km from our home. The first stage of the new Seppeltsfield Road  shared path trail runs through our property. The Barossa also has other bike trails.
host_about: I'm a born and bred, proud Barossan. Married to Martin for 47 years we have 3 adult children and 8 grandchildren. 30 years of teaching has kept me young at heart. I love meeting people through our family winery and I'm very involved in the local community. I'm known as 'the Green Queen', somewhat obsessed with  recycling and caring for the environment. I'm an animal and nature-lover, loving life on our beautiful property and happy to share it with others.

name: The Barn - a little bit rustic, a little bit luxe
description:
Nestled on 5 acres in the Barossa Valley, Pondicherri Village and The Barn is a private property and hosts accommodation in a village atmosphere in the separate outbuildings. The extensive rural views and privacy are enabled as it is surrounded by much larger working farms. Combined with rural amenity, Pondicherri Village has several historical buildings and creates a rustic oasis, yet is close to all that the beautiful Barossa Valley offers. The Barn is one of those buildings.

The space
The Barn is a single room building constructed with thick stone walls and exposed internal timber beams. The building is aged well over 100 years. We are not sure of its original use. Today, the Barn is furnished with a very comfortable super-sized king bed complete with crisp white sheets and natural fibre quality bed linens. In winter, you will keep very toasty with the individual dual zoned electric blankets. The bed is so spacious, it is also perfect for travell
neighborhood_overview:
Pondicherri Village is a short 3km drive into the historic village of Angaston that is well serviced with a varied selection of cafes, restaurants, 2 pubs, a supermarket, butcher, hardware, medical centre, post office, retail and speciality Barossa food businesses. It is also very close to the Barossa
Farmers Market that is open every Saturday morning.

There are many high-quality wineries, restaurants, food establishments and historic buildings to explore across the region.

If food and wine are not your things, there are numerous walking and cycling trails, some easy bushwalks including spotting kangaroos at Kaisersthul Conservation Park. Or you could go ballooning or a helicopter ride for the bird's eye view! Just about everything except surfing! But we are about one hour's drive to the nearest South Australian coastline, only one+half hour's drive into city of Adelaide and a one hour drive to the Adelaide Hills area. There is so much

name: The Dairyman Barossa .. The Chaff House
description:
Exclusive self-contained Farm Accommodation set in the foothills of the Barossa Ranges. A fusion of heritage, functional architecture & edgy style, located between Lyndoch & Williamstown in the beautiful Barossa Valley.

Take in the stunning views from every direction – vineyards, rolling hills & farm life.

Enjoy an abundance of traditional breakfast provisions straight from the farm.

Google for more information...thedairymanbarossa

The space
The saying is true: the grass is greener on the other side, especially as you cross the paddock and unlatch the galvanised farm gate at The Dairyman’s Cottage entrance. This is Barossa country chic at its finest with a clean style that is as comfortable as it is design savvy.

This reinvented getaway dates back to the 1840s. Stretch out in the Chaff House, a workshop where grain was once crushed, or hole up in the Dairyman’s Cottage for a stay that shares a similarly unique past, o
neighborhood_overview: We are 5-15 minutes from regional towns and many cellar doors close by
host_about:
The saying is true: the grass is greener on the other side, especially as you cross the paddock and unlatch the galvanised farm gate at The Dairyman’s Cottage entrance. This is Barossa country chic at its finest with a clean style that is as comfortable as it is design savvy. 

This reinvented getaway dates back to the 1840s. Stretch out in the Chaff House, a workshop where grain was once crushed, or hole up in the Dairyman’s Cottage for a stay that shares a similarly unique past, operating more recently to milk cows. Both pads now make up a relaxed and unpretentious Barossa getaway and can be booked in conjunction with one another or as separate retreats. 

Guests can quite literally wake up and smell the bacon, thanks to a healthy spread of breakfast provisions and other fresh produce that come directly from paddock to plate. And although your Barossa itinerary is likely to be teeming with sojourns to cellar doors and eateries, it's hard to overlook the peace that lazing in the shade of the South Australian sun brings. Take in the rich pastures and surrounding panoramas of the grape-dotted Barossa Valley Ranges, by spending the evenings on the paved terrace with your feet up, sipping a glass of something smooth from neighbouring vineyards. 

It's instinctual to wander the working dairy facility, so why not introduce yourself to the residents on an afternoon farm walk and feed the heritage breed free-range pigs. And if there are any items you can no longer live without when back home, The Dairyman has an online shop to keep you stocked up on breakfast packs and more.

neighborhood_overview: 5-15 minute drive to regional facilities. Close to cellar doors and restaurants
host_about:
The saying is true: the grass is greener on the other side, especially as you cross the paddock and unlatch the galvanised farm gate at The Dairyman’s Cottage entrance. This is Barossa country chic at its finest with a clean style that is as comfortable as it is design savvy. 

This reinvented getaway dates back to the 1840s. Stretch out in the Chaff House, a workshop where grain was once crushed, or hole up in the Dairyman’s Cottage for a stay that shares a similarly unique past, operating more recently to milk cows. Both pads now make up a relaxed and unpretentious Barossa getaway and can be booked in conjunction with one another or as separate retreats. 

Guests can quite literally wake up and smell the bacon, thanks to a healthy spread of breakfast provisions and other fresh produce that come directly from paddock to plate. And although your Barossa itinerary is likely to be teeming with sojourns to cellar doors and eateries, it's hard to overlook the peace that lazing in the shade of the South Australian sun brings. Take in the rich pastures and surrounding panoramas of the grape-dotted Barossa Valley Ranges, by spending the evenings on the paved terrace with your feet up, sipping a glass of something smooth from neighbouring vineyards. 

It's instinctual to wander the working dairy facility, so why not introduce yourself to the residents on an afternoon farm walk and feed the heritage breed free-range pigs. And if there are any items you can no longer live without when back home, The Dairyman has an online shop to keep you stocked up on breakfast packs and more.

name: 1837 Barossa Luxury Vineyard Cottage. S Australia
description:
Beautiful villa facing vineyard. French provincial style in Lyndoch, fully equipped kitchen, bathroom with spa, 2 showers, 2TVs, outdoor sitting with views of Barossa Ranges and vineyards. Enjoy the beautiful Barossa sunrise from your bedroom and sunset from the William Light Monument Park on our estate. Coffee (Nespresso) and tea provided. Stroll around vineyard and watch out for kangaroos and native birds. Wi-Fi included.

The space
A whole country house to enjoy and relax. Surrounded by beautiful vineyard and surrounding Barossa ranges. You have your own spa and shower, fully equipped kitchen, lounge room and front verandah to enjoy the views.

Guest access
Guest are welcome to stroll around the vineyard, visit the William Light monument and read the history of Barossa Valley.

Other things to note
Cofee and tea is provided.
neighborhood_overview:
Surrounded by lovely vineyards and wineries, kangaroos and beautiful birds.
A perfect place to relax and enjoy the calmness of the country yet just an hour away from Adelaide. Stroll around the vineyard and enjoy the breathtaking views of the Barossa Ranges. Visit Colonel William Light Monument on the estate.

name: Fechner Place★Barossa Studio★ 1 Bed★Breakfast★Wine
description:
The Fechner place guest suite is Located only minutes from some of the Barossa Valley's finest restaurants and Cellar Doors and a 15 min walk to Tanunda. Dozens of restaurants and Cellar doors are within less than 20 minutes’ walk.

The space
The Fechner Place guest suite is a small contemporary space, beautifully furnished for a relaxing and comfortable stay. The Queen Bed has been fitted with all natural fibre quality bed linens. The adjoining en suite bathroom has environmentally sustainable shampoo, conditioner, body wash and soap. The open layout includes a kitchenette with microwave, coffee machine, kettle, fridge, toaster and breakfast area. Teas, milk, butter, sugar, coffee, juices, fresh fruit, cheese, locally made bread, biscuits and conserves are provided complimentary. The area comes with a flat screen television. The modern bathroom has good quality towels, bath mat, hand towels, tissues, toilet paper, hairdryer and straightening Iron.

A p
neighborhood_overview:
The studio is located on a lovely quiet street, with its own private entrance and parking. Located in the heart of the Barossa and walking distance to the main street of Tanunda, you are perfectly positioned for easy access to many of the great wineries, restaurants and experiences that the region has to offer.

We are a 2 min drive from the pretty village of Tanunda that is well serviced with a varied selection of cafes, restaurants, pubs, 2 breweries, supermarket, butcher, bakeries, specialty retail stores, a medical centre, hospital and post office for your convenience.

We are a short 10 min drive to the famed Barossa Valley Farmers market in the picturesque township of Angaston, which is open on Saturday mornings from 7.30am. This is on our must do list.

If food and wine are not your thing, there are numerous walking and cycling trails with some easy bush walks through Kaiser Stuhl National Park. This is best visited at dusk to do som
host_about:
I've lived with my partner and 3 gorgeous children in the Beautiful Barossa Valley, South Australia for over 40 years. We enjoy spending time outdoors with our family on our 30 acre property.
We have both worked in the wine and Tourism Industry for the last 20 years and understand the importance of great guest experiences. We have travelled extensively and experienced all types of accommodation.  I have been able to use what I have learnt to create a very successful Airbnb business (Air Stay Hosting).
I have a keen interest and passion in real estate and travel and now enjoy combining both by hosting properties through Airbnb. We love creating beautiful, comfortable spaces that our guests can call "home" and pride ourselves in offering a 5 star service. Our aim is that our guests never want to leave!

name: Barossa Valley Studio
description:
Situated in the heart of the Barossa Valley within the beautiful township of Angaston. Our Self Contained Studio gives your privacy with views of Angastons Hills. The Studio has it's own Kitchenette, ensuite bathroom and a small bunk bed room for two kids*. On the exterior guests have full use of the guest BBQ.

We are located a short 800m walk along a the beautiful trail into Angaston township. Nearby are many restaurants, cafes, wineries.

*Note lower bunk is rated to 120kg and upper 80kg

The space
The studio is the bottom level of our two story property. You will have full and private access to the bottom level which can only be accessed through the main door.

Due to us living upstairs, there may be some slight noise but we endeavour to keep it as quiet as possible.

Outside features beautiful gardens and views, a bench to take it all in and a BBQ area to enjoy our gardens and entertain yourselves if you wish.
neighborhood_overview: Angaston is a beautiful picturesque town located in the Barossa Valley. Within the town there are services such as a butcher, supermarket, pubs, cafes,  restaurants, barossa cheese company and many more other attractions.
host_about: I am married to my beautiful wife and live in the stunning barossa valley. While working in the wine industry we also host our studio through airbnb. I love to travel, having been to around 40 countries and all 6 continents (not antartica). The experiences travelling brings is second to none, food, culture, adventure, architecture. From travelling we have stayed in a mix bag of accommodations, local homestay, villages, to high end hotels. Meeting and greeting people all over the world has enticed us to start out own studio and airbnb on our property in the beautiful township of Angaston in the Barossa Valley.

The space
Recently renovated from the ground up 'The Acre' is a purpose-built holiday retreat. neighborhood_overview:
So close to the town centre yet far enough away for peace and quiet.

Just a 2 minute stroll down the road is Discovery Parks Barossa Valley. The family section of the park includes a splashtacular waterpark, complete with three slides, gigantic tipping bucket and more splash zones than we can count. (day passes available for $15, family and group pricing available on request).

And while the kids are playing in the water the folks can pop across the road to Barossa Valley Brewing. The brewery houses a Brasserie and stunning beer garden with live music from 4 - 7pm every Saturday and Sunday.

These are just two of the many cafés, galleries, museums and within walking distance, and dotted around the main street of Tanunda.

name: Meander Retreat - relax in the country
description:
Meander Retreat is a small rural property near Eden Valley in the Barossa region, amid vineyards and open pastures. Your studio is equipped for comfort and there are both sunny and shady places around the property in the olive grove, gardens or mixed orchard to write, paint or just daydream. Meander will make you meander, change your plans, sleep long and sweet, and just untangle. The kitchen will be stocked for a great breakfast (with vege/vegans happily catered for).

The space
The spacious and sunny guest studio has a king bed, single sofa bed, a fully equipped kitchen and palatial bathroom. There is car parking directly alongside the studio so you have easy access to the private entrance (where you can arrive at any hour and let yourself in via a passcode). The studio has natural cross-ventilation and a ceiling fan, but also has RC air-conditioning for year round comfort. Artists and writers will find this the perfect spot for their creativity and those
neighborhood_overview: The Eden Valley is the higher altitude section of the Barossa Region, which produces world class cool climate wines, but it is also a peaceful and less populated area, so it is perfect for just relaxing and unwinding.   There are vineyards and a few cellar doors nearby but there are many more 20 minutes away down in the valley itself. Springton is 2 kms away and has a general store and a pub.  Nearest supermarkets are  20 mins away.

The space
The Villas offer beautiful, environmentally sensitive accommodation in a striking bush setting. Reflecting the region's agricultural roots, The Villas harmonise unique architectural design with simplicity and warmth, creating a peaceful, secluded Barossa retreat.

neighborhood_overview:
Marananga is a delight to explore, set amongst beautiful rolling hills and vineyards. The village is home to numerous cellar doors, five within an easy walk of The Villas. The award-winning Seppeltsfield Road Distillers are our near neighbours, and the renowned restaurant Appellation at The Louise is also within walking distance.

A drive along Seppeltsfield Road's iconic avenue of palms will wind you through the vineyards of the western Barossa with its well-known wine brands and intriguing small batch wine producers. Historic Seppeltsfield Estate is home to Seppeltsfield Winery, Vasse Virgin, Jam Factory Art & Design Studios and Fino restaurant. Just around the corner you'll discover Hentley Farm Cellar Door & Restaurant.

If you're looking for some adventure, try ballooning or a Segway, helicopter or trike tour. Or maybe a sunset cruise in a Mustang?

Beyond Seppeltsfield Road, the Barossa is a wonderful playground. More than 170 wineries, with

name: Strothers Farm House ~ Angaston, Barossa Valley
description:
Strothers Farm House *** Newly Renovated 2018 *** SELF CONTAINED ACCOMMODATION
The 100-year-old stone house is set on a hill top on the outskirts of Angaston.
Is ideal if you’re looking to escape for a Romantic Getaway or share with a group of friends. This is the perfect house as a base while exploring the Barossa Valley or to relax in the peace and quiet.

The space
Strothers Farm House features 3 spacious queen-sized Bedrooms. Included a full Kitchen/Dining, a luxurious Bathroom with Walk-in shower and Spa Bath, separate Toilet and Wet area. Heating and cooling are catered for with a combustion heater and has a fully ducted air-conditioning throughout the home. Generous provisions will be provided for breakfast for the first morning of your stay.

Guest access
Access – We have a key safe on the property, so access is easy.
We can be contacted on the phone or via email.
Shops are just a short drive away, Angaston Main S
neighborhood_overview:
HISTORY
The property is set on 20 acres and was originally set-up as part of the Soldier Settlement Scheme in 1920 by Leslie George Strother (a returned WW1 Soldier). It has had a couple of owners throughout its time including Alan’s Grandparents, and Parents who both farmed the property. Today the property is mainly used for grazing Sheep.
host_about: I'm a non drinker that Worked in the Wine industry for over 20 years before retiring. Enjoy holidaying, camping.

Designed by renowned architect Max Pritchard, the award winning Barossa Glasshouse was built in 2012 and quickly
became recognised as one of Australia's most iconic houses.

The space
Luxury Boutique Retreat... Barossa Glasshouse is a house unlike any other, nestled into the hillside capturing breathtaking panoramic views... enjoy a luxury experience unique to the Barossa Valley region.

name: The Comforter of Hearts - Barossa Valley
description:
We live inside an award winning Merlot Wine vineyard on 5 acres in the beautiful Barossa Valley. The house is rock and mortar built in 1837. We are fairly isolated and are surrounded by amazing fauna and peaceful views of the vines and beyond. We are only 25 minutes from historic Tanunda and busy Nuriootpa by car only and along dirt roads. Wake up to a vast variety of birdsong and idyllic surroundings.

The space
We offer a comfortable bedroom with Queen size bed, own fridge, TV, toaster, kettle, and an Italian style, do-it-yourself continental breakfast. You have your own entry door which leads to an outside shared toilet, however we have a mobility toilet you can use in your room. The shower/bathroom is shared, and the bathtub is separate and found inside the laundry. Excess to the bathroom is via the lobby. Use of laundry is free or for an additional $10 we can do it for you. Spa can be used with 24 hours notice at no additional cost.

Guest access
neighborhood_overview: We are a part of the majestic Barossa Valley, yet isolated and intimate. Own transport is a must. Taxis into the townships of Angaston, Tanunda, or Nuriootpa are around $50 each way. Unsure of Uber costs.
host_about:
Enjoy being home and loving all of our animals!
And my wife of course! Enjoy travelling and shooting competitions too.
I enjoy fixing and creating things at home and don't mind a bit of cooking!

Barossa Bliss is a very short drive to the main street of Nuriootpa where you will find restaurants, cafes, shops and the visitors information centre.

The space
The home consists of 4 bedrooms with the master bedroom complete with ensuite, ducted heating and air conditioning throughout with a lovely outdoor area perfect for relaxing the day away.
Barossa Bliss is great for all types from couples, friends or families looking to relax and explore

You will have access to our entire home except for the garage and walk in robe. We want you to feel like you are in a home away from home.

name: Wings Barossa Bird & Bush Retreat - Barossa Region
description:
A 2-Storyed, 3-bedroom country home, a 170-acre getaway that's exclusively yours, ideal for that special alone or to be enjoyed with friends. The perfect location to stay whilst exploring the many wineries & restaurants set amidst the natural beauty of this world-famous area. High in the Barossa Ranges, only one hour's drive through scenic hills from Adelaide CBD. Birdwatching/ Bushwalking on your doorstep. Extensive marked trails with abundant wildlife. A total experience-not just another B&B.

The space
Full Cooked Breakfast Provisions for first 2 mornings stay, Fully Equipped Kitchen & Dining, Lush Bedding, Electric Blankets, Fireplace, BBQ, Outdoor Dining, Marked Walking Trails, Day-Cabin by Lake, Abundant Wildlife and Birdwatching Opportunities

Guest access
Country Home & 170acres - Exclusivley Yours !

Other things to note
2 night minimum stay
neighborhood_overview: Located a short drive to the abundant selection of wineries and restaurants set amongst the spectacular natural beauty of the Barossa.
host_about:
We are a family-operated/ father-daughter team!
We love wine, time spent in nature, our kids/grandkids and the Barossa of course!!

This is one of Tanunda's iconic houses which is centrally located in the heart of Tanunda. Beautifully styled and decorated with many features of the era. Polished floorboards, ornate ceilings and a sweeping verandah are just many of the features of this beautiful home. Perfect luxury for that group holiday or family stay. Walking distance to the town centre and the many restaurants and cafes we have to offer.

The space
This is a gorgeous location in a beautiful leafy street amongst other heritage homes. The space has many welcoming features and is your home away from home. We have a lovely spacious deck to enjoy the gourmet platter of local produce and wine provided on arrival.

Guest access
We have a keyless entry into the house and details will be provided closer to your check-in date.

We can be contacted between 7am and 8pm.

Guests will have full access to the house, outdoor areas during your stay.

name: The Chapel
description:
Marriage proposals, weddings - it has all happened at The Chapel. Today, The Chapel is an elegantly renovated circa 1849 church in the small town of Lyndoch. The old ironstone exterior, the cathedral ceilings, contemporary decor alongside the cottage gardens and vistas of the Barossa ranges, make for a memorable Barossa experience and a great romantic weekend retreat and/or relaxing getaway.

The space
The Chapel has two queen beds.

The main bedroom is upstairs with its own ensuite shower and toilet. It is a loft style bedroom. The second bedroom is located downstairs in the open plan living room.
It is shared space with one queen bed that can be partitioned off with curtains for privacy.

The main living room has elegant cathedral ceilings, combustion glassfront fireplace, soft carpet floors and contemporary decor and a big comfortable sofa to sink into whilst enjoying a glass of Barossa wine.

neighborhood_overview: Lyndoch is a delightful country town set in the southern part of the Barossa superbly positioned as the gateway into valley itself .   It is home to some great wineries, historic buildings, cafes and restaurants.
host_about:
Hi

name: Lucy's House
description:
Heritage Wines has renovated the original cottage on the Heritage Wines estate, which dates back to the 1850’s.
Lucy’s House is a self-contained bed and breakfast for 1 couple, with a beautifully appointed bedroom and bathroom and a fully equipped kitchen. Taking in the view of the vineyards and Barossa ranges, all of which can be soaked up through the cottage windows while relaxing in the pioneer cast iron bed.

The space
Generous provisions for a continental or cooked breakfast using homemade and local Barossa produce, plus a complimentary bottle of wine is provided.

You are welcome to visit the winery to view Lucy’s House anytime. We look forward to any further enquiries.

Included in your stay at Lucy's House:
Television
Queen sized bed
Air Conditioner
Full Cooking Facilities
Wireless Internet
Electric Blankets
Underfloor heating in bathroom
Complimentary bottle of Heritage Wines wine
Acce
neighborhood_overview:

The Loft is a beautiful 2 storey apartment with loft ceilings, renovated to host visitors in the Barossa Valley. The space is light and clean, furnished with modern neutrals and natural textures. All amenities are either organic, locally grown or made.
Located centrally in Tanunda, you are at walking distance to some of the best cafes, restaurants and local shopping in the Barossa.

The space
The 2-storey apartment has been beautifully furnished for a relaxing and comfortable stay. Upstairs has 2 bedrooms, one king bed and one queen bed both with natural linen and cotton bedding. The bathroom features a large rose shower head and environmentally sustainable shampoo, conditioner, body wash and soap complimentary. Also located upstairs is a toilet and laundry. name: Wine Tasting By Day-Swim Under The Stars By Night
description:
Nestled on the ridge of Greenock in the famed Western Ridge of the Barossa Valley, The Clyde caters for the exclusive use of 2-6 people and is fully equipped for a weekend trip or a long, relaxing holiday. The main suite boasts an ensuite with rain shower & deep freestanding bath. The stunning, 3 bedroom self-contained boutique accommodation offers you the perfect base to spoil yourself, whether you venture out and immerse yourself in Barossan life, or stay in and indulge in a restful break.

The space
Sparkling Inground Magnesium Pool for your private use with alfresco deck. Huge front deck with parkland views. Guests receive a complimentary bottle of Barossa Wine on arrival. The pantry will be laden with an array of artisan-made, Barossa breakfast provisions, delicious local produce to prepare a platter at your leisure and locally made fudge. Beautiful guest toiletries by Aromatherapy Co. are supplied.

One night stays and last minute bookings may be
neighborhood_overview: The Clyde is perfectly situated for you to explore the charming village of Greenock itself – with 5 cellar doors, micro-brewery, tavern, unique shopping and the renowned El Estanco Café, all within a leisurely stroll.
host_about: Janine and Matt have spent the last 2 years lovingly renovating this 1950's beauty. Matt has worked in the wine industry for the last 25 years and is currently a Company Director in a Vineyard Management Company supplying premium grapes to Treasury Wine Estates. Janine is a nurse and together they have 2 boys aged 21 and 15.  They live on just over an acre of land on the outskirts of Greenock.  Janine will be your host during your stay at The Clyde, ensuring you have the most ultimate accommodation experience the Barossa has to offer.

name: 'In The Vines' Guest Cottage, Barossa Valley SA
description:
Welcome Back! With strict adherence to COVID safe best practices, we’re delighted to once more be open for guests.

‘In The Vines’ Guest Cottage, nestled among long-views of vineyards, villages & church spires. Fully appointed, our private accommodation is ideally placed to explore all that is The Barossa.

Minutes from the Barossa Farmers Market, cellar doors, galleries, cafes & award winning restaurants. Perfect for that romantic getaway, or quiet enough to focus on your business plans.

The space
After a lifetime of traveling ourselves, we settled in the Barossa Valley, bought a beautiful house with a vineyard, and renovated our guest cottage.

'In The Vines' Guest Cottage has a fully equipped kitchen, queen sized bedroom with luxury linens, cosy lounge dining area, modern bathroom with walk in monsoon shower, a laundry and free WiFi.

We offer you cheese and biscuits to match with the wines you've discovered, great br
neighborhood_overview:
The famous weekly Barossa Farmers Market is just a kilometre away, open every Saturday morning - amazing produce, you'll also make friends in the short queue for a superb coffee.

Just across from the market is the award winning Vintners Restaurant, and we are situated not far from the four main villages of Angaston, Nuriootpa, Tanunda and Greenock. From ice creams, handcrafts, boutiques and pubs, we can recommend something to suit your preferences.

Likewise, cellar-door tours, balloon flights and more can easily be arranged, all picking up from your cottage.

Or just lay in one of our hammocks with a great bottle of wine and a book, we can supply most of your needs until sundown. We want you to become another returning guest, looking forward to your next stay with us - Your home from home, 'In The Vines'.
host_about: Andrew and I are an easygoing couple, enjoying our life out in the country where we grow grapes, tend our fruit trees, and enjoy mixing within the local community spirit that is country Australia. Let us introduce you to some new friends too!

There is so much to enjoy within walking distance.

Modern, light filled, comfortable house

Whole house exclusively yours.

name: JHA Stone Cellar
description:
The JHA Stone Cellar is a blend of old and new with thick stone walls and large glass windows for wonderful farm views.

2 king bedrooms, both with en-suite bathroom, (1 bedroom splits to two king singles if required), large living area, butlers pantry, mud room and 3rd toilet.
An out door shower, under floor heating, air-conditioning and quality fittings through out giving our guests an exceptionally relaxed experience.

The space
The J.H.A. Stone Cellar is a purpose built refurbishment of one of the oldest remaining stone buildings on the property. Sitting on a gentle slope in the north west corner of the farm, looking over the old vine Shiraz vineyard, this two bedroom premium accommodation is the ultimate escape.

Guest access
Enhance your stay by cooking yourself a paddock to plate meal. We produce a range of seasonally available produce including: our premium wine, ethically grown lamb and chutneys/preserves. Pre order i
neighborhood_overview: Angaston township is 10 minutes away by car with specialty shops as well as all the services that might be required. The wider Barossa has more than 150 winery/cellar doors, 7 award winning restaurants, cafes, bakeries, art galleries, heritage sites, scenic bike tracks, parks and 2 golf courses.
host_about: I am part of a mixed family farm in the Barossa, with a strong interest in food and wine.

name: Tomfoolery Winemaker's Cottage - Barossa Valley
description:
Situated at the home of Tomfoolery Wines in the Barossa Valley, this newly renovated cottage is only about an hours drive north of Adelaide.
Located on the 20 acre winery property it is complete with all of the luxuries to enjoy your time away, including a king sized bed, a large spa, robes, Sheridan towels, wine and a full lounge area to relax in.

The space
Guests are able to walk through the vineyard and stroll through the orchard where they can help themselves to fresh fruit and veggies - season dependent. Also if you visit during the harvest season you are welcome to visit the team at the winery and see the production in full swing, we may even get you to lend a hand.

A two night stay has generous inclusions such as free wi-fi, Nespresso Machine, beer, wines, cheese, local muesli, bacon & eggs, juice, Molten Brown and Vasse Virgin amenities, Robes & Slippers, Netflix and much more.

There is also an indoor pool which is exclusively f
neighborhood_overview:
The Farmers' Market which opens every Saturday morning is just up the road so you can explore all the local produce the Barossa has to offer and top up on fresh supplies.

The three major towns of the Barossa Valley are all located within 10 minutes of the cottage and there are many other wineries and a variety of restaurants close by making it a fabulous location for a wine region getaway.
host_about:
Hi - I am Sarah. A Mum of 2 who is passionate about making sure our guests have the best stay every time.
We also own and operate a boutique winery in the beautiful Barossa. And we love what we do!

name: Williamstown Bed and Breakfast
description:
BAROSSA ACCOMMODATION IN WILLIAMSTOWN.
The Williamstown B & B is the perfect Barossa getaway for up to 6 guests. Located in the cosy town of Williamstown our beautifully renovated house is full of history and is conveniently located close to shops, bakery, restaurants, wineries and tourist attractions.

The space
The 'Old' Cottage have been complete re-furbished for comfortable living - everything is NEW!

Our location is right in the heart of Williamstown on Queen Street which is easy to find and access.

You'll love venturing out for the day to wineries, events and attractions but more so coming home to relax and get comfy.

Guest access
You have the whole house and back area to enjoy.
We live 100m back behing your accommodation and are close by if you require assistance or directions.

We are honey producers and bee keepers (not on the property!) at remote location

Lindsay House Homestead offers 5 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, fully equipped kitchen and laundry facilities spread over two levels. Relax and take in the spectacular views on offer.

name: Barossa Valley Gundaroo - we offer 1 night stays
description:
Gundaroo retreat is located on the fringe of the Barossa Valley and set on 50 acres of picturesque land with rolling farmland, trees and hills. Perfect for a romantic getaway or a girls weekend away. The cottage is set in a scenic location and provides a pleasing blend of rustic charm with modern conveniences. It has 2 bedrooms with queen size beds a cosy wood fire and a lovely deck to relax and enjoy your morning coffee. We provide breakfast provisions for the first day and a bottle of wine

The space
The cottage is attached to the main house and separated by an outdoor entertaining area. We are a working alpaca farm and will sometimes be working on the tractor or in the garden. You are more than welcome to wander around the garden and go up to the fence to see the alpacas.
We also offer a bottle of wine on arrival and have a Nespresso coffee machine available as well as a range of teas. We also provide bacon, eggs and milk.

Guest access
neighborhood_overview: There are so many places to visit that are quite close to us.  Birdwood with the motor museum is 5 minutes drive away, Gumeracha with the big rocking horse and wildlife park is 10 minutes.  If you like fishing or kayaking, the Williamstown reservoir is less than 10 minutes down the road.  There is also the Lavender farm at Williamstown and the wineries at Lyndoch are about 20 minutes away.  If you enjoy walking, Mt Crawford forest is also less than 10 minutes away.  There are some beautiful cafes  and local pubs in all of the towns that are close by.  Tanunda wineries are approx 30 minutes away and also the Barossa valley Chocolate Company.  Mount Pleasant is approx 5 minutes away, so if you are going to a horse show we are close by if you want to stay.  Monarto zoo is also approx 40 minutes away.
host_about: I am a mortgage broker and my husband is a carpenter.  We enjoy renovating houses and are renting this one out for the first time as a bnb.  We own an alpaca farm in Cromer, where you can pat and walk the animals, we currently have approx 15 alpacas on the farm.  We have 3 grown children and 2 dogs.  We also enjoy travelling.

name: Ironstone on Jollytown
description:
A characterful ironstone cottage located in the heart of the Barossa. Equipped with all the modern amenities for the most discerning guest. The interior is a mix of contemporary and old to give the cottage a light, bright and airy feel while remaining true to it’s longstanding heritage. Situated on a large block, the garden wraps around the cottage to provide many places in which to relax and unwind.

The space
*** Please note that we have now converted the second bedroom into a reading/relaxation space. The main bedroom has now changed to a king size bed with brand new 'Emma Sleep' mattress. Lounges have also been upgraded and do not reflect the current listing photos. New photography coming soon :) ***


This beautiful ironstone cottage built in the mid 1860’s is located in Lyndoch; a quaint and historic town situated in the heart of the Barossa Valley. The cottage has been newly renovated with a fresh, modern interior, but is also sympathetic to
neighborhood_overview: Our neighbourhood is quiet and full of friendly people who always seem to be willing to stop for a chat. The lyndoch hotel is a short 15 minute walk down the road. If you prefer a glass of wine over a beer however, the lovely Reis Creek cellar door is situated just opposite. Lyndoch is a fantastic location as it is central in relation to many wineries and cellar doors. Barossa Chateau, Kies Family Wines, Kellermeister and Chateau Yaldara are all within 5 minutes driving distance of the accomodation. If you are looking to partake in a spot of golf, Sandy Creek Golf Club is a short 5 minute drive, while the Tanunda Pines Golf Club is located only 10 minutes away from the accomodation.
host_about: Brooke & Peter are Barossa Valley locals. Peter was born in Queensland and moved to South Australia to pursue a career in winemaking. Brooke is a born and bred Barossan who recently traded in her career in the wine industry to become a full time Airbnb host.

name: Tal Haus - In the heart of the Barossa Valley
description:
In the heart of the Barossa! This well appointed home is perfectly located in the centre of Tanunda. Tal Haus is on the main street, and a just a 3 minute stroll to some of the region's finest restaurants and wine bars.

It is an older style home - built in 1928, it is a little piece of Barossa history and a great location to explore all that the region has to offer. Tal Haus offers all the comforts of home - suitable for couples wanting a relaxed getaway or a family who needs some space.

The space
There are two bedrooms with luxury queen beds. The large living space offers dining for up to 8 people and one of the sofas can be converted into a queen bed also.

The kitchen has everything you need, so you can cook up a storm or wander down to one of the local eateries. Full use of laundry facilities, free WiFi and access to Stan Streaming Service so you can watch all the latest television shows and movies.

There is a cosy no
neighborhood_overview:
Tanunda is in the heart of the Barossa so you can head in all directions and find lots of things to see and do - including some of the world's best food and wine. Some of our favourites that are five minutes walk away include....

Ferment Asian - one of Australia's finest modern Asian. Not only is the food great, the award winning wine list is something to behold - http://www.fermentasian.com.au

Vino Lokal - Wine Bar, Restaurant and Tasting room you can sample some of the region's finest from wine producers. It is the home of Artisans of the Barossa which includes John Duvall, Hobbs of the Barossa, Spinifex, Sons of Eden and Schwarz Wine Co. And the food offerings from the Chef, Ryan Edwards are absolutely sensational. http://www.fermentasian.com.au

Musque - is the epitome of a modern eatery and bar, they have over 500 gins to sample but you can get a decent bottle of local wine, grab a burger or enjoy a more sophisticated dining experience. https:
host_about: I am anArts and Cultural Consultant with my own company Play Your Part.  Married, 2 kids living in the beautiful Barossa Valley.  We are not locals but have lived in the region since 2009 and have gotten to know the place really well.  I am a pretty social person - I love a long lunch, visiting galleries and museums or a day out with friends at the pub but could quite happily spend a day at home in front of the fire.

The cottage has access to its own private driving range , plus many many more hidden gems tucked away.

name: 'Allawah' Barossa, Luxury accommodation in Tanunda
description:
Welcome to Allawah Barossa, meaning "stay here, rest, sit down" to the Indigenous Australians. We hope that you utilise our home to recharge, reconnect and enjoy all that the beautiful Barossa Valley has to offer.

Allawah offers 2 x king-size rooms, 1 x double room, with a portacot and high chair available on request.

We live close by and are more than happy to help with recommendations for your stay. A guest book with local information is also provided to enhance your visit.

The space
We provide breakfast provisions of locally smoked bacon, free-range eggs, crusty Apex bakery loaf, and tomatoes for guests for your first morning's breakfast. An assortment of condiments, oils, spices, jams, vegemite and basic cooking needs also provided. A Nespresso machine, tea, milk etc also provided. A welcome bottle of premium local Barossa wine provided for your enjoyment.

There is a gas fireplace in living room, air conditioner and ceiling f
neighborhood_overview: The world-famous Barossa Valley is home to many wineries, restaurants and attractions. Our home Allawah is located 400m from Tanunda's vibrant main street, home to many cafes, restaurants, wine bars and shopping. The visitor information centre is also located here just 400m from our house. We will provide you with an information guide with details of all local services, including personalised recommendations.
host_about: Hi, I work at a local Barossa winery hosting guests on a daily basis. I love meeting new people and showing them all that the beautiful Barossa has to offer. I am happy to share recommendations of places to visit and the incredible dining destinations we have here. We have travelled to many parts of the world so have a very good understanding of how the thoughtful extras in accommodation make the world of difference to your stay.

name: Ruby’s Residence: LOCATION - cozy - WIFI - netflix
description:
A sister to Lavender Cottage Barossa.

A cozy place in central Tanunda, the heart of Barossa Valley, in a quiet street but only 100m from the main street:

- under five minutes walk to the iconic Fermentasian and 1918 restaurants, the popular Z wine bar, Musque restaurant and Vino Lokal as well as the Barossa Tourist Centre,

- easy walking distance to Foodland and Priceline pharmacy,

- 50 metres away from Tanunda Recreational Park,

- 20 minutes walk to Chateau Tanunda and Barossa Museum.

The space
*A clean modern spacious 3 bedroom house with en-suite as well as a bathroom with a separate bath and shower.

*Free WiFi with BOSE internet radio or bluetooth from your phone.

*Large screen TV with free NETFLIX and Apple TV.

*Quality linen, towels and toiletries.

*Fully equipped kitchen including dishwasher, coffee machine also washing machine, dryer, hair-dryer and iron.
neighborhood_overview:
Elizabeth Street is one of the main streets in Tanunda with beautiful quiet neighbourhood.

The Oval/Recreational Park is just 3min walk away.

We are also a short walking distance to the major attractions of Tanunda (restaurants, cafes, shops, museum, wineries, tourism centre, oval, parks, etc).
host_about:
We live in Tanunda which my husband has called home for 30+ years and we both enjoy music, food, wine, travel, and much more. 

With these passions, we will try our best to make your stay enjoyable in this lovely wine region. 

Cheers,
Lizha* & Geoff

*Lee-sa

name: Tamu Barossa
description:
Tamu Barossa is a fully self contained guest house with a blend of classic and modern design set on our lush two-acre property a mere 3 minute drive from the quaint little town of Lyndoch, the gateway to the Barossa Valley. It is separate from our main house so you will have full privacy to enjoy our cosy guesthouse.

The name ‘Tamu’ means ‘sweet’ in Swahili and ‘guest’ in Malay. A happy coincidence that pays homage to Kenya and Malaysia, where my husband and I originated from.

The space
At Tamu you can relax on your private verandah and sip some local wine or enjoy a delectable cup of tea.

Take a stroll and wander around our property. We have a variety of young fruit trees, herbs, flowers and there are a lot of established gum trees and cypress pine which attract a number of birds such as the Rainbow Lorikeet, Kookaburra and honeyeaters. You will also be able to meet the kangaroos that hop in and out of our property to graze. Our landscaping
neighborhood_overview:
We are just a 13 minute drive to Tanunda the cosmopolitan heart of the Barossa with the best restaurants, entertainment and cellar doors. Award winning winery Kellermeister is just a two minute drive from us. The winery is rated in the top 7% of Australian producers by Australia's acclaimed wine critic, James Halliday.

For those who are a bit more adventurous, the Altona CSR Landcare Reserve which is highly rated on Tripadvisor Australia is located just opposite our property. It has a 6km walking track and is a great place to observe the wildlife and vegetation. Or you could wander down on to the Barossa Trail which is a shared cycling and walking path that goes from the outskirts of Gawler through Lyndoch, Rowland Flat, Tanunda, Nuriootpa to Angaston.
host_about:
I made the tree change with my husband Kipi and our two children in 2017 having lived half my life in Melbourne's hip and busy inner suburbs and the prior half in Malaysia. Now I enjoy a slower paced life surrounded by beautiful nature and amazing people.  

I love cooking and entertaining friends and family around my table. Our little family also enjoys travelling, particularly back to Malaysia and Kenya to visit our big families.

We renovated and converted the run down pottery studio on our property to a charming little guesthouse for our friends and family to stay when they visit us. We are happy to share our slice of paradise with travellers and holidaymakers. Meeting new people is always a pleasure and I look forward to hosting you and making your stay a comfortable and memorable one.

name: Entire cottage, quiet, romantic, self contained
description:
Devitt on French B&B is a step back to the old charms of yesteryear with the modern amenities that make for the perfect escape to the Barossa Valley. Complete privacy with a magnificent look out from the front verandah for your morning coffee. Ideally set amongst the oldest houses in Angaston shaded by Jacaranda and fruit trees, this quiet street is an easy walking distance to the main street coffee shops, wine tasting rooms, popular restaurants, and more. Check yourself in on arrival.

The space
Newly renovated with style and charm this 2 bedroom luxurious cottage was built in the late 1800's from marble quarried on site. A fully equipped kitchen that will entice you to become the creative chief.
A collection of antiques including crockery that are to be used and enjoyed during your stay to experience high tea at its best. BBQ facilities available with outdoor fire pit and a bath tub and shower that will exceed all expectations. Breakfast essentials
neighborhood_overview: Angaston is known as the Jewel of the Barossa and has many great coffee shops, wine tasting rooms , cellar doors  and restaurants from pizza, Italian cuisine, modern Australian to the Barossa Valley Cheese Company are all a short walk away. Or hire a bike from Angaston Hardware shop to ride the bike tracks of the Barossa or book a Barossa wine tour that can show you the sights and memorable places of the region.
host_about: I am married with 2 children and live on a farm where we bread Angas Beef cattle and Dorper sheep.  I am an artists and involved in arts and cultural engagement in the Barossa

name: Greenock's Old Telegraph Station
description:
Escape, Relax, Unwind, Explore.....
Experience all that the Barossa Valley has to offer from your home away from home in this restored heritage cottage located in a charming village.

The space
The cottage is for your exclusive use when you stay. It offers accommodation for up to five guests. There are two bedrooms (one containing a queen bed, the other a double bed and a sofa bed).

The separate lounge room has comfy couches, with television and a selection of DVDs to watch.

The self catering kitchen contains a cooktop, microwave, fridge, tea and coffee making facilities.
The large bathroom contains a 2 person spa with shower over, hand basin and toilet. There is also a washing machine.

Heating and cooling is provided by reverse cycle air conditioning and a combustion heater.

Outdoors, in the fully enclosed rear garden (pets welcome by negotiation) is a gas barbecue with hood, undercover table and seating.
neighborhood_overview: The cottage is nestled among award winning cellar doors and a boutique brewery. Just a few steps away is a licensed cafe for breakfast or lunch and a genuine country pub for dinner.

A cozy place centrally located in Tanunda, the heart of Barossa Valley, in a quiet street but only 100 metres from the main street:

- under five minutes walk to the iconic Fermentasian and 1918 restaurants, the popular Z wine bar, Musque restaurant and Vino Lokal as well as the Barossa Tourist Centre,

- easy walking distance to Foodland and Priceline pharmacy,

- 50 metres away from Tanunda Recreational Park,

- 20 minutes walk to Chateau Tanunda and Barossa Museum.

The space
THE SPACE & CONTENTS:

*A clean modern spacious 3 bedroom house with en-suite as well as a bathroom with a separate bath and shower.

*Free WiFi.

*Large screen TV with free NETFLIX and Apple TV.

*Quality linen, towels and toiletries.

*Fully equipped kitchen including dishwasher, coffee machine also washing machine, hair-dryer and iron.

*A secure undercover parking and adjacent free stre
neighborhood_overview:
Elizabeth Street is one of the main streets in Tanunda with beautiful quiet neighbourhood.

The Oval/Recreational Park is just 3min walk away.

We are also a short walking distance to the major attractions of Tanunda (restaurants, cafes, shops, museum, wineries, tourism centre, oval, parks, etc).
host_about:
We live in Tanunda which my husband has called home for 30+ years and we both enjoy music, food, wine, travel, and much more.

Cheers,
Lizha* & Geoff

The space
Angaston Vineyards Motel is centrally located in the heart of the Barossa Valley, 2 Km from Angaston, 4 Km from Nuriootpa and 9 Km from Tanunda.

It sits across the road from Vintner's Bar & Grill and the famous Barossa Farmers Market and only 500 metres from Salter's restaurant. The Vineyards Motel offers friendly and professional service and is the perfect base for daily excursions around the Barossa Valley's many cellar doors and other sights.

The Motel has 20 units of various configuration and can take groups up to 52 people. It has a pool area with BBQ facilities overlooking the beautiful Saltram's Vineyards.

Bus Tours to several points of interest can be organised from the reception.

With Angaston a five-minute drive in one direction and world class wineries a five-minute drive in another, Vineyard Views has you covered. You can stay in and watch the sunset from the deck with a glass of shiraz, or you can use the peaceful location as a base to visit nearby cellar doors and other Barossa attractions.

This light filled home welcomes you to relax, cook, wine and dine away at the spacious kitchen and 8-seater dining table.
A Bluetooth receiver and speakers ensure you can listen to your favourite songs.
3 bedrooms have electric shutters and the 4th has plantation shutters for a calming night’s sleep.
The enclosed rear garden is secure for children.
The house’s water supply is rainwater.

The space
The kitchen is well equipped. The neighbourhood is very quiet. Modern touches include Smartkey entry and USB ports.

Guest access
The entire home, garage and garden are for you and your family or friends to relax and enjoy.
We will be readily contactable if needed.

Other things to note

neighborhood_overview:
Many of the local boutique and larger wineries offer free wine tastings. We can help with suggestions, plus there is information and pamphlets on local wineries, restaurants, suggested tourist routes and other activities.
The home faces a park which is home to kookaburras and other bird life, and has a flat walking trail for walkers, cyclists and runners. Stroll around the nearby Bush Gardens to see various displays of local native plants including the Sensory Garden. The 5km ParkRun is held in the park each Saturday.

name: Under the Vines....a Vineyard Escape!
description:
Under the Vines is a self contained cottage in five acres of vineyard and native bushland, in the heart of the beautiful Barossa Valley.

Peaceful and private, this beautiful accommodation is perfect for couples, small groups and families, and is a lovely base to explore the Barossa region.

Every window has a vineyard view!

The space
The spacious living area - with comfy sofas, beanbag, cushions and snuggly blanket - is set up with complimentary Wi-Fi and Netflix, a large smart TV, PlayStation & Blu-ray DVD.

The main bathroom has a huge double shower and luxurious two-person spa, and a generous selection of towels, earth friendly body and spa products, and flatscreen TV/DVD (viewed from the spa).
Bathroom 2 features a coloured rainshower.

The kitchen has full facilities - oven, cooktop, microwave, refrigerator, dishwasher and coffee machine, and and a great range of regional provisions included for breakfast/brunch
neighborhood_overview:
Easy driving distance to world class wineries and food destinations, quirky cafes, parks, walking and bike trails. Come and explore for yourself!

The Barossa Valley offers many unique and rich experiences - food, wine, culture, heritage. Allow time to immerse yourself in some of these....and then come back again for another bite!

name: Historic Valley House in the Barossa Valley
description:
Min stay 2 nights, Check in 2pm - 8pm Check out 10am. Our guest suite has your own private entrance and is in the middle of Lyndoch, our lovely little country town. We are in the Barossa Valley and minutes away from world famous wineries and plenty of attractions. Valley House is a great base to explore the Barossa Valley, Adelaide Hills and Adelaide. Our guest suite is spacious and a short walk to the local cafe, restaurant, bakery, general store, hotel, pharmacy and several wineries.

The space
The guest suite has a spacious lounge/ dining room, bedroom and en suite bathroom. Our fireplaces are NOT operational. Your comfort is assured as we have reverse cycle ducted air conditioning and a ceiling fan in your bedroom. We provide coffee and tea making facilities, a microwave and small fridge. You are welcome to play our antique piano. Please be gentle as it is a family heirloom.

Guest access
You have the entire dining, lounge, bedroom and
neighborhood_overview: We are blessed with an award winning cafe, a delightful bakery, a delicious restaurant, a great country pub, a nice park, a peaceful recreation ground (including tennis courts) and many fantastic wineries within a stone's throw. We also have a walking trail and bicycle trail that runs right through the Barossa Valley (Gawler to Angaston) which is within two minute's walk.
host_about: Along with my wife Lee, I have enjoyed staying at many Air BnB locations. We have a lovely historic home we are looking forward to sharing with others. We enjoy chatting with guests to share what we know of Valley House and the fantastic Barossa Valley.

name: THE VINES   Barossa, Adelaide Hills & Murray River
description:
Set in the township of Mount Pleasant only a 5 minute walk to the local Saturday Farmers Market. You are in a private space independent and set behind the hosts main residence.You have your own parking space and a lock key box will gain you entry. Your privacy is a high consideration so we are here if you need us otherwise you are completely independent.Close by are many attractions. Stay two nights and get a welcome gift including a Bottle of wine. Continental breakfast included.

The space
You will be able to drive up to your own private parking space. The guest suite(converted granny flat) has everything that you need for a short stay.Your private space is separate from the hosts residence. You have your own porch area to sit and enjoy a drink. Inside there is a kitchenette with electric frypan, toaster and microwave please note there is no oven or cook top. Pantry items such as oil, salt and pepper are available. A wide selection of teas and coffee are availa
neighborhood_overview: Mount Pleasant is a lovely country town that feels rural however is close to so many wonderful tourist destinations.The famous Farmers Market on every Saturday morning 8am-12pm. Pick up wonderful fresh fruits and vegetables all locally grown.There are cakes, pastries and amazing coffee. The breakfasts are also wonderful with something for everyone. We have two hotels, two bakeries, a lovely quaint book and gift shop in Mount Pleasant all within walking distance. Considered the gateway to the Barossa there are local wineries just ten minutes drive or a 30 minute drive and you will be in the heart of the Barossa, with countless attractions. Twenty minutes in another direction and you can be sitting on the banks of the river Murray in the lovely township of Mannum home to the  paddle steamer The Murray Princess.We are also close to the Adelaide hills with many other wineries to enjoy.
